sub_title: Communication Manager at Delft University of Technology's Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering
summary:
I’m a multilingual communications professional, with an above average interest in design and a love of storytelling.  Having spent 11 years in communications at the global technology firm, Dyson, I relocated to the Netherlands in 2015, my current home.  Here I have the dream design communications job at TU Delft’s Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering, leading the communications team. Working with the University’s talented researchers and students, we are in the privileged position of telling the story of Delft Design and its impact across sustainability, health and mobility at a time of great change.

I have experience in building and leading teams, building networks and developing strategies but I also enjoy being hands-on. I am skilled across a wide-spectrum of communications actives including media relations and product launches; ghostwriting and speechwriting; events management and internal communications; developing online content and crisis communications.

I am an English native speaker with the bonus of being  highly competent in Dutch, French and German. I can also speak basic Japanese (JLPT level 3).

Stories by Design, my communications consultancy is a little quiet these days (too busy with the day job) but if you’re interested in my help, do get in touch.

education.degree_name: Year of study as part of Cambridge degree in Modern Languages

publications.name: DroneClash 2019: high-tension, high tech and good humoured

authors.headline: Communication Manager at Delft University of Technology's Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering

profile_positions.description: I lead the communications team in the world's biggest design school here at Delft University of Technology. Together with my talented colleagues, we have the enviable task of telling the story of the changing role of design in an increasingly complex world (clue: it's less about products these days but addressing societal challenges such as sustainability, health and mobility by developing services and systems). With the help of inspiring scientists and students, we create and share stories of Delft Design to attract future students, raise the profile of our research and build a strong community. Like the design process itself, this job is shifting and developing each day that goes by. I'm always learning and I think it's that which keeps me hooked.
profile_positions.title: Communication Manager for the Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Stories by Design is here to help. To help you convey your story. I will work with you to create a communications strategy that resonates and develop content that brings your story to life. Whether you’re a start-up, a multinational or a not-for-profit, 

My subject of choice is design itself. Design in the widest sense of the word: solving problems and making things work better. To tell the story of design is to give an insight into human ingenuity. But as technology becomes ever more complex, that story tends to be glossed over with empty soundbites. I help you get to the crux of what you do and communicate this. Stories by Design can help you achieve your  goals - whether that be building your profile, changing the debate or securing more sales and investment.
profile_positions.title: Director
Marketing and Communications Consultant (Stories by Design)

profile_positions.description:
Set up CSR department from scratch, building a cross-functional team of eight to measure and reduce Dyson’s social and environmental impacts, empowering Dyson to communicate on these topics with confidence and integrity.  During this time I:  
- Led and authored Dyson’s first publication on sustainability, “Lean machine”, managing design, translation into 9 languages and international launch with programme of guest speakers: http://www.dyson.co.uk/medialibrary/Group/Documents/PDF/Sustainable_Engineering/UK_LEAN-MACHINE-BROCHURE-ENG-MASTER.pdf
- Played a key role in Dyson’s project team for introduction of EU’s Energy Label and Ecodesign Directive for vacuum cleaners. Recruited and managed public affairs agency to build network of influencers in Brussels, drafting Dyson position papers and lobbying NGOs, MEPs and officials at the European Commission for a better label. This behind-the-scenes work resulted in coverage in European broadsheets and www.euractive.com and ultimately, a partial win for Dyson and the environment - with the introduction of limits on the size of motors in vacuum cleaners
- Improved Dyson’s performance on retailer sustainability scorecards (eg. doubled Dyson’s score on Walmart’ Sustainability Index -  a factor in purchasing decisions)   
- Pioneered Dyson’s responsible sourcing programme in South East Asia, including writing Supplier Ethical and Environmental Code of Conduct and crisis communications
profile_positions.title: Head of Corporate Social Responsibility - Strategy|Leadership|Sustainability Communications

profile_positions.description:
Led Dyson’s philanthropic arm which focuses on encouraging more young people into careers in design education. In addition to managing a 	small team and running an education programme in schools and 							universities, I:
- Was responsible for campaign to achieve planning permission and funding for the £16 million Dyson School of Design Innovation. Created a website and promotional literature, set up public meetings and coordinated and chaired high profile meetings between Sir James Dyson, CEOs and government ministers, including at 10 Downing Street.  These efforts resulted in Bath City Council granting conditional permission
- Managed media activity in conjunction with the Dyson Press Office - both locally and nationally and acted as spokesperson in absence of Sir James Dyson, including interview on BBC news
- Successfully launched the James Dyson Foundation’s education in Malaysia and managed HRH Prince Andrew’s visit to Dyson Malaysia, resulting in international media coverage
profile_positions.title: Head of James Dyson Foundation - Philanthropy|Stakeholder management|Media Relations|Fundraising

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for growing and managing Dyson’s philanthropic arm.  During this time, I:
- Expanded education programme, establishing relationships in international universities and introducing the James Dyson Design Award for students in 20 countries to increase reach and impact of charity
Briefed and assisted Sir James Dyson on tour of Japan to launch Dyson cordless vacuum and the James Dyson Foundation, resulting in press coverage in the Nikkei newspapers and many magazines.
- Collaborated with graphic agency to develop James Dyson Foundation’s identity and branding
profile_positions.title: James Dyson Foundation Manager - Strategy| Branding| Education Programme| Press Launch

profile_positions.description:
Based in busy London Press Office, I:
- Summarised daily press stories for company-wide media cuttings 
- Edited bi-monthly internal newsletter for a readership 2,500 people  
- Wrote articles on behalf of Sir James Dyson for publication in international press 
- Event management - e.g. sports day, Dyson Christmas Party for 1,000+ people and company meeting
- Developed education programme, working with Dyson engineers to run design workshops and lectures in schools and universities, prior to establishing the James Dyson Foundation as a registered charity
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications/Education Executive - Newsletter| Event Management| Education workshops

profile_positions.description:
- Taught English conversation to 15-18 year olds in academic Japanese high school.
- Wrote and presented a seminar to an audience of more than 200 new JET Programme participants, on the topic of “How to Cope Financially in Japan” as part of their Tokyo induction week (2002).
- Organising and participating in cultural exchange activities, for example setting up English language classes for pre-school children, running English cookery class and dancing in the summer festival in traditional dress.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Language Teacher

profile_positions.description: Based at the Zinzendorfschule in Niedersachsen, Germany, as part of the British Council's Assistant Language Teacher programme, I taught English to 16-19 year olds, also providing pastoral support for boarders.
profile_positions.title: English Language Teaching Assistant

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer on project to create award winning mosaic in Achtertuin Park in Delft

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteer speaker for “The World in Your Classroom”  programme to introduce Dutch schoolchildren to different countries and cultures (Stanislas College, Delft, 2017).
